sentence.Network_en: Without sleep you will become a zombie at work.
sentence.Network_cn: 不睡觉的话，工作起来会变得反应迟钝。

sentence.Network_en: I didn't want to do anything, I just sat at home and vegetated. I became a total zombie.
sentence.Network_cn: 我什么也不想做，就是呆坐在家里，过着百无聊赖的生活。我完全变成了行尸走肉。

sentence.Network_en: His nights filled with dreams, his days with work - just like a zombie.
sentence.Network_cn: 把夜里的事交给梦,白天的事交给手脚, 他仿佛是个能干活的死人.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 19th cent.: of West African origin; compare with Kikongo zumbi 'fetish'

entry.tran: 麻木迟钝的人;毫无生气的人;无精打采的人
entry.def: You can describe someone as a zombie if their face or behaviour shows no feeling, understanding, or interest in what is going on around them.

example.ex: I didn't want to do anything, I just sat at home and vegetated. I became a total zombie...
example.tran: 我什么也不想做，就是呆坐在家里，过着百无聊赖的生活。我完全变成了行尸走肉。

example.ex: Without sleep you will become a zombie at work.
example.tran: 不睡觉的话，工作起来会变得反应迟钝。

entry.tran: （恐怖故事或某些宗教中的）僵尸，还魂尸
entry.def: In horror stories and some religions, a zombie is a dead person who has been brought back to life.

means.word_mean: 1. a dead body that has been brought back to life by a supernatural force
2. (voodooism) a spirit or supernatural force that reanimates a dead body
3. a god of voodoo cults of African origin worshipped especially in West Indies
4. someone who acts or responds in a mechanical or apathetic way;
5. several kinds of rum with fruit juice and usually apricot liqueur
